inn1.comm: outside off, fairly close to wide but Taylor gets away with it as Smith lets it go
slightly closer to this time, Smith again lets it go and there's no sign of any movement
beaten, well bowled by Taylor who pitches fuller and Smith comes across the ball with an angled face and is fortunate not to get an edge...that was very similar to how he dragged on at Centurion Park
comes onto the front foot and punched firmly to cover
slanting across Smith who watches it go through...Taylor flirting with the wide markers
another leave to end the first over, a tidy start from Taylor and Smith taking a few balls to gauge the pace and bounce
he starts with a wide fired down the leg side
hits a better line and length this time, on middle and it nips back at Gibbs who is cramped for room and is struck on the thigh pad
speared down the leg side again, Edwards struggling with his line early on as he is prone to do
short and outside off stump, it sits up inviting Gibbs to free his arms but the drive goes straight at cover
on the stumps, Gibbs tries to work through midwicket but doesn't make contact
right on cue, another wide down the leg side...a long start for Edwards

full and on middle stump, Gibbs leans forward and meets it with a strong defensive push down the pitch. Rampaul dives across from mid-on and knocks the ball out of the reach of mid-off so they get a single, the first run off the bat
Smith goes back and across, defended into the covers
comes forward to a delivery outside off stump, defended back to Edwards to end a long over
drifting onto the pads and Gibbs flicks it down to fine leg with superb timing, the ball races across the outfield almost before the fielder can move
better line from Taylor, Gibbs comes forward on off stump and defends back to the bowler
turned off middle stump with strong wrists, quick to come into the front foot, and picks out wide mid-on
defended into the covers
keeping Gibbs in defence on off stump, bat and pad together as cover again comes into action

well bowled, first blow for West Indies as Gibbs pushes forward and gets a thick edge through to Denesh Ramdin. Taylor deserved that after a decent start, but for Gibbs its a depressingly familiar dismissal as he reached for the ball outside off stump
angled away down to third man in typical one-day style and brings Jacques Kallis into strike
top start from Kallis, Edwards loses his line onto leg stump and Kallis whips him away through square leg...effortless
corrects his line this time, on off stump and Kallis defends from the crease
again on the pads but Kallis doesn't make contact this time and picks up a leg bye into the on side
defended carefully into the covers
outside off and left alone...Edwards needs to help Taylor at the other end to build pressure
Kallis come half forward and gets a thick inside edge into the leg side
back of a length outside off, Smith picks up a single to third man with an open face
very neat from Kallis, comes right across the crease and takes this from off stump through midwicket...that shows how much time the batsmen have
driven firmly into the covers
keeps Kallis watchful as he comes forward and defends to mid-on

key strike for Taylor, Kallis drives on the up towards mid-off and Shivnarine Chanderpaul moves to his left to pouch a good, vital catch...Kallis looks down at the pitch, the ball may have stopped a little but he wasn't very far forward in his drive
comes forward and drives to mid-off, decides against a quick single...Smith needs to forge a recovery
touch too short and wide, Smith cuts backward of point but third man is quite square and keeps them to a single
sharp bouncer, 146.6kph, takes de Villiers by surprise who gets in an awful tangle as he turns his head away and takes a blow on the gloves up by his helmet
regains his composure and leaves outside off to a fuller ball
back of a length, defended into the covers
forces de Villiers to hop into his defensive shot, plays down by his feet
full outside off stump, Smith drives back towards the bowler who makes a half-stop in his follow-through
Smith gets away with one, banged in shorter and Smith guides (but without knowing too much about it) the ball between slip and gully...why wouldn't you have two slips?
pushed into the covers...Taylor continues to impress on this tour
opens the face and defends towards backward point
Smith tries to copy Kallis by walking right across his stumps but only succeeds in edging into his pads and the ball dribble into the off side
picks a slower ball, clips firmly to midwicket who makes a sharp stop
outside off and left alone, that's the line Edwards needs to stick to
same again from both bowler and batsman
banged in heading down the leg side, de Villiers goes for the pull and there is a huge appeal as Ramdin takes the ball but Daryl Harper correctly spots that it took thigh pad not glove or bat
lets this go harmlessly outside off
full and outside off, can't tempt de Villiers into the drive
on off stump and de Villiers defends down the pitch. Tight over from Edwards, a maiden
driven firmly to mid-off who is quite wide
dragged down short and Smith latches onto it very quickly, pulling through square leg for a welcome boundary
goes across his stumps, defends into the leg side and there's an easy single on offer
on off stump, defended from the crease at the top of the bounce
turned into the leg side as de Villiers stays on zero
onto the front foot and pushed into the covers
takes a big strike forward and drives firmly to mid-off, Smith sets off straight away but it might have been close if mid-off hadn't fumbled
defended up to mid-on
hammered off the back foot but straight at cover as de Villiers still can't get going
finds the gap this time, between cover and mid-off, and with perfect timing to open his innings in style...that's a classical cover drive
turned off the pads to midwicket
outside off and left alone
Taylor drifts wide and Smith tries to cut, gets a bottom edge back towards the keeper
a little short outside off, cut to backward point
half volley this time, Smith leans into a drive but picks out mid-off
slower ball and very full at Smith, who just about picks it and jabs into back down the pitch
another slower ball, but this goes very wrong as it loops way down the leg side...Smith had even walked across the crease so he was even further away from it
waits and cuts but can't beat backward point
very full, Smith tries to drive but doesn't time it and ends up looking at the bottom of his bat...a mixed bag in that over from Taylor as he tried a series of slower balls
that's not a good start, nothing more than a slow long-hop which de Villiers is only too happy to pull dismissively through midwicket

this one goes even further, another dreadful ball from Rampaul which just sits up and begs to be clubbed. de Villiers doesn't need a second invitation and pulls it over the fence at square leg and suddenly his innings is rocking
now the off side is peppered as de Villiers plays a delightful back-foot punch through the covers...that was all timing but still too short from Rampaul
a minor victory for the bowler...it's a dot ball outside off stump as de Villiers watches it go through, the ball actually shaped back a touch
this is help yourself from Rampaul and de Villiers is cashing in...tries a bouncer and de Villiers walks across to the off side and pulls backward of square
outside off and left alone, all or nothing in that over...mostly all from de Villiers who cracked 18 off it
tries to swing through the leg side, doesn't make contact and Ramdin bobbles the take
bisects the gap between extra cover and mid-off, more sweet timing and the ball races away over the quick outfield
straight at mid-off from this drive
chopped down to third man
on off stump, defended back to Sammy
drifts towards leg stump, de Villiers misses out and is annoyed with himself
starts with a full ball on off stump, Smith digs it out back down the pitch
whipped from outside off stump through square leg, Smith really likes the leg side...that could easily have gone through the covers
wide and full, handsomely driven through the covers but there is a sweeper on the cover boundary now
another boundary, they are flowing, as Smith takes a ball from outside straight back past the bowler. He didn't time it perfectly but the outfield did the rest
angled towards backward point, a quick call from de Villiers means a safe single despite a sharp piece of fielding from Sammy
defended down to mid-on
beaten outside off stump as he comes half-forward to a ball outside off
driven on the up to cover
big shout for lbw, Smith had come a long way across and, in fact, came so far that he was struck outside off stump
turned into the leg side
more pin-point precision driving between extra cover and mid-off as Sammy over pitches, races away to the boundary
defended into the off side
defended into the covers
short and pulled away over midwicket as de Villiers again takes advantage, he had so much time to play that shot
on off stump, defended back to the bowler
pushed square on the off side
dropped into the leg side, thinks of a single but there's no chance
a flowing drive from de Villiers, but the sweeper keeps him to a single and means he's on strike next over
defended to cover
flicked to midwicket
defended softly into the covers
an extravagant flick of wrists from de Villiers gets a single backward of square on the leg side
pushed to midwicket
dug out back to Sammy, better over and West Indies need more of that
back of a length and punched up to mid-off...he's already doing better than his last over
but it can't last as he drags this hopelessly short and de Villiers pulls it over midwicket and must be thinking this is Christmas time
Rampaul is in real trouble here, drags another in very short and de Villiers goes even more powerfully over midwicket...Rampaul is being torn apart, but the bowling is awful
de Villiers now has the confidence to move around his crease but ends up defending into the off side
goes to the other extreme, a low full toss, and de Villiers squirts it through point without much timing
turned through the leg side, another poor over from Rampaul and he is leaving Dwayne Bravo in a difficult situation
overpitched on off stump, Smith goes through his favourite area at midwicket for another boundary
adjusts his line to wider outside off, Smith cuts and Parchment at backward point pulls off a great dive
carved through the covers, out to the sweeper
flicked through midwicket, the fielders are back on the edge of the circle and there are plenty of gaps
dragged down short, just no consistency from the medium-pacers, Smith has all the time in the world to roll his wrists and pull down to long long
flicked to midwicket and now there's a misfield from West Indies which allows a bonus for Smith...the wheels are threatening to come off here
outside off and a drive takes a thick outside edge down to third man
turned into the leg side
another slow long-hop, Smith pulls through midwicket but not with enough power to beat the sweeper to runs around from deep square-leg
driven straight at mid-off
drives towards mid-off, but only gets half a bat on it...sets off for a quick single but another fumble at mid-off makes it comfortable
turned into the leg side
de Villiers misses a cut outside off, nicely taken by Ramdin who is stood up
punched down to mid-on
slower ball, picked, and driven to cover
de Villiers almost swings himself off his feet as he plays a flat-bat drive through the covers
flicked down to mid-on
defended into the off side, very gentle stuff from Sammy but at least he has slightly better control over his line and length
on middle and leg, defended into the leg side
driven to mid-off for a quick single, but the fielder is half asleep
comes down the track and tries to slog-sweep him over square leg, but after all the effort doesn't make contact
nicely played, waited for this one outside off stump and glided it fine down to third man
comes forward and defends
flicked into the leg side
angled away down to third man from outside off stump
driven to extra cover, can't find the gap
again picks out extra-cover, this time off the back foot
flicked out to deep square-leg
punched down to long-on

out of nowhere Sammy makes the breakthrough, de Villiers is caught on the crease, playing back when he should have been forward and the ball was heading halfway up middle stump. The end of an entertaining innings.
chopped down to short third-man
swept from middle stump out to deep backward square-leg
play and miss as he tries to cut
hint of turn, dabbed past slip who gets a hand on it
cut off the back foot through the covers
punched back to Samuels
covers up in defence
back and across, defended to the on side
driven up to mid-on
onto the front foot, opens the face slightly and picks out cover with a drive
turned off the stumps wide of midwicket and long-on has now been pushed back so it's an easy single
guided fine down to third man, played very late and brings up Smith's fifty off 65 balls
defended into the on side
classy shot from Duminy as he rocks back to a short ball and cuts through backward point, beating the over sweeper
dribbles to short fine-leg
off the back foot, punched to midwicket
short and wide, cut away and backward point makes a mess of a standard stop...gifts two more runs to Smith
goes for a sweep, takes the pad into the off side
defended from off stump...looks like off spin?
driven down to long off, whatever spin it is, it doesn't turn
turned through square leg
whipped through midwicket, keeps the strike rotating
driven down to long-off
punched back to the bowler
defended into the off side
nudged back to the bowler
driven to mid-off, who is deep enough for an easy single
plays an air shot outside off stump, hint of turn
defended back down the pitch
powerful sweep, in front of square, from Smith to spoil a tight over
driven down the on side, Chattergoon makes a good save in his follow through
back to the bowler
flicked down to long-on
full and turned to midwicket
very slow, Smith picks out square leg
quick single to midwicket as Chattergoon races through another over
quicker ball from Samuels, Smith gets an outside edge down to third man and didn't have much of a clue about that one
driven up to mid-off
short and wide, carved through the covers out to the sweeper
turned off the stumps into a gap at midwicket
defended square into the covers
flicked off leg stump out to deep square leg
swished off the back foot to deepish cover
driven on the walk to long-on
fuller and pushed defensively into the off
turned from around the pad to midwicket
outside leg, helped down to long leg and Duminy was quick there, came back for the second like a greyhound
pushed back to the bowler
back and punched to midwicket but no power in the shot
hit straighter and the ball trundles to long-on
tossed up and forward to defend
worked to short third man
driven to long-off
pushed more than driven to long-off and the batsmen stroll the single
driven through extra cover, Sammy in the deep slides to save the four
pushed back to the bowler
flicked past midwicket
deflected round the corner, not-too-long leg fields
paddled to the right of midwicket
pushed into the ground and it dribbles a few yards into the leg side
steps back cut to point
cuts straighter into space
sweeps, misses, it flicks the pad and goes fine through where first slip would be and on this outfield it scoots for four
wide and really thumped ... but straight at extra cover
short, wide, cut hard to deep point
back and he can do no more than defend
turned to midwicket off the back foot
steered fractionally behind on the off side but both batsmen yell "no" early on
short, cut hard but still only the single
missed out there, on leg stump and flicked to midwicket
full toss patted firmly to long-off
short, punched to the right of long-off where Sammy is in quickly to scotch thoughts of a second
cut through point
cracking straight drive, Samuels drops to his knees but not quickly enough, long-on easily across to mop up
pushed to long-off
steps back but cuts hard into the ground with a groan
flowing drive to the right of long-off
sweeps across the line, not timed and the ball bobbles down to backward square leg
Smith comes down the track but gets cramped and blocks
turned off his legs right at square leg
swept on line and length, long leg fields
pushed oh-so-gently to slightly deep extra cover
swept and this time he gets power and placement, to the left of square leg and finally a few horns and shouts from the crowd

dropped sweeps again uppishly but the ball dies on Smith at midwicket, he gets his hands to it but can't hold on an inch from the turf ... the ball squirts through him and there's a run as well to add to Chattergoon's sense of being wronged
back and punched hard to long-on ... Smith walks the single muttering all the way
reverse sweep, he was twirling into position as Samuels hit the delivery stride, and it bisected the two men behind square on the off side
pushed into the covers

he looks to push the ball into the off side, gets the thinnest of edges and a jubilant Ramdin hurls the ball to the heavens ... even the taciturn Samuels can't hide his delight as he team-mates mob him
jabbed firmly to backward point
pushed hard back to Samuels
thick edge, backward point chases hard and does well to save the third
back, waits and helps it down to long leg
clipped to midwicket
down the track but ends up digging the ball out into the leg side
pushed to longish-on
too short, cut hard but there's a sweeper out there for that very shot
back and blocked
good bowling ... punched to extra cover
short, he cuts but it's not wide enough and he misses
full, back to the bowler
mistimed drive bobbles into the off side, no pace and that allows the single
turned to square leg, an easy one but the fielder makes a hash of an easy stop although no runs result
dispatched through the covers first up, Boucher did well to dig that one out it was very full
just a defensive push up to long-on
tries to turn into the leg side, plays slightly early and it dribbles back to the bowler
good yorker, on middle stump and well dug out into the covers
played into his boot and loops into the offside
runs the ball to backward point with an open face
very full and wide, Duminy goes for a wild drive but doesn't make contact. Half an appeal for a catch, not given and therefore must have been close to a wide
low full toss put away through extra cover with excellent timing as Duminy's good form continues
driven down to long-off
drives and gets a thick inside half of the bat through midwicket, in the air but very safe
another low full toss driven down the ground
played very late down to short third man, a yard either side and it was runs but it went straight to the fielder
defended to backward point
chopped into the pitch, bounces up to point who makes a direct hit at the non-striker's end and allows a second run...harsh on a good piece of work
angled down to third...looks like Duminy will play the anchor here
good yorker on middle and leg, Boucher manages to flick out to deep square-leg
chopped down behind the batsman, rolls towards third man but Ramdin does the chasing
another guide down to third man
slower ball heaved down to long-on with a fairly agricultural shot
well played, outside off stump and guided very late and very fine down to third man...another fine shot from Duminy who is enjoying an impressive start to the series after his 79 the other night
nudged back to the bowler
worked into the off side
another meaty swing from Boucher, this time a low full toss goes through midwicket
worked through square leg, brings up Duminy's second consecutive fifty of the series off 66 balls...an attractive innings
a seven-ball over and the extra delivery is swung down to long on
a fine blow from Boucher, searching for the yorker but not full enough and Boucher swings through the line straight down the ground for a hearty six

the bowler gets his revenge, again it wasn't quite a yorker but Boucher swings across the line and misses...the ball crashing into middle stump. Important wicket for West Indies because Boucher can cause serious damage late on
Pollock gets a good yorker first up, digs it out into the covers and after some confusion gets off the mark with a quick single
opens the face and runs down to third man
placed wide of backward point and the cover sweeper does the work
turned into the on side, can't find the gap
slower ball, Pollock spots it and waits before opening the face to third man
nicely driven through the covers, sounded as though it came off the bottom of the bat
worked up to long-on
another slower ball is late cut to third man
this time Pollock doesn't read the slower ball, or execute the shot cleanly, as he slices it over backward point but it lands between two fielders
punched down the ground and he'll keep the strike
carved through with some force, third man runs around the rope and does some swift work
driven through extra cover, well placed and there's time for two as long-off runs round
searching for the yorker, Pollock goes across the line through midwicket, along the ground and it's just a single
not quite finding the yorker, Duminy gets underneath it put picks out deep square-leg on the bounce
low full toss, clipped sweetly through midwicket but again can't find the boundary
another brace through the covers, a good tumbling save by the long-off but still nine off the over
driven through the covers, but cover makes a good dive to get a hand on it
gone, trying to guide down to third man but Ramdin dives across and takes a good catch. Another South Africa batsman goes before he can do major damange
good yorker, outside off stump and Botha can't get a bat on it
goes for a nifty sweep, picks out short fine-leg but they collected a sharp single
slammed down to long-off with nearly enough force to reach the boundary but another good piece of work by Devon Smith, the sub fielder, prevents the boundary
yorker on leg stump, swung into the leg side with such force that Duminy nearly loses grip on his bat
big swing and a miss as Duminy tries to go over midwicket but is beaten by a slower ball
flicked into his boot and the ball rolls back towards Edwards but they scamper a single
flicked towards midwicket, at first look it appears it's a drop catch but it didn't reach Rawl Lewis - another sub - by a few inches
cracking shot, too short and Duminy latches onto it and pulls high and handsome through midwicket
pushed out into the covers
turned to midwicket, Botha will have strike at the start of the last over
bouncer, good thinking from Edwards and Botha doesn't even have a go at it
picks out long-on with precision as he goes for big drive down the ground but doesn't connect out of the middle. A comfortable catch on the boundary and Botha's stay was brief

misses a huge swing, ball skims past leg stump and Duminy thinks of stealing a bye...Ramdin is quick with his throw and hits direct, Duminy wasn't able to turn quickly enough and he goes for a fine 68
uses his feet, comes down the track and backs away outside leg stump...swings hard and finds cover with a strong drive

mayhem from South Africa...Morkel has a huge swing and also misses, Steyn calls him through for another bye. Ramdin doesn't hit at his end, but the throw is collected by Taylor who throws down the non-striker's and Morkel is well short. No need even for the third umpire this time
the innings finishes with another wild and woolly swing, this time from Langeveldt and this time the batsmen don't run. A fine last over from Taylor.

inn2.comm: right on the spot first up, off stump, and Parchment plays from the crease down to mid-on
fuller and outside off stump, Parchment comes forward and plays towards backward point. He thinks there's a single but Herschelle Gibbs pulls off a great stop
comes forward again, defended into the off side
defended square on the off side towards point
outside off and wide enough for Parchment to leave but it's a good channel from Pollock
back of a length, brings another defensive push into the covers and Pollock starts with a maiden
outside off stump to the left-handed Chattergoon, left alone but there is some nice shape back into the batsman. The first sign of swing for the match
on the stumps this time, Chattergoon comes down on it and turns into the leg side where square leg does the fielding
full and searching for one of those deadly yorkers, Chattergoon squeezes it into the leg side and they scamper the first run of the innings
drifting down the leg side, struggles to adjust for the right hander, and an easy decision for the umpire
full on middle stump, Parchment meets it with a strong defensive push which Steyn gets a hand on in his follow through
full and swinging away, Parchment reaches out to drive and gets a thick edge down to third man
well bowled, angling across the left hander who plays a drive without any footwork...that will keep Steyn very interested
played back to the bowler
takes the pad into the leg side
pushed across the batsman again, left alone this time which is a better option that the airy drive from earlier
another leave as Pollock settles in outside off stump
forced off the back foot to cover
chopped into the ground close to the batsman and it dribbles into the off side...another maiden for Pollock
punched off the back foot and the ball is intercepted in athletic style at backward point by AB de Villiers...he was almost horizontal at one point
full and swinging away from Parchment, draws a forward push and he's beaten by the outswing
angled down to third man with the swing
another wild drive from Chattergoon outside off stump without any footwork, doesn't make contact
driven off a thick inside half of the bat wide of mid-on...not much on offer for the batsmen at the moment
slower ball and well picked by Parchment who flicks it nicely through midwicket
dropped into the leg side and Chattergoon sets off for a single, that was never on and if the throw from Duminy had hit he was a long way out
drifts onto the pads and nicely flicked down to fine leg for the first boundary...a rare loose ball from Pollock

gone, the first breakthrough, as a delivery bounces alarmingly from a good length and takes the shoulder of the bat looping towards de Villiers at point. It's a simple catch, but that ball came out of nowhere...a few have kept a little low today, but none have climbed like that
and this one keeps low outside off stump, jagging back at Morton who was shaping to cut and is beaten all ends up. Almost takes out off stump and plenty for the batsmen to think about
well bowled, Morton beaten by an outswinger on this occasion as he pushes forward onto the front foot.
beaten again, comes half forward and is prodding outside off stump as this one holds its line. An outstanding over from Pollock
pushed out to backward point
outside off and left alone
full outside off stump and defended to point
slower ball and picked by Chattergoon who laces a drive straight at cover
defended out to cover...no momentum here for West Indies
width outside off stump and Chattergoon frees his arms and slashes high over backward point, the ball comfortably beats third man
defended into the leg side, Morton wants a single but it would have been another suicide attempt as Duminy is quickly in
defended into the off side, Morton hasn't settled yet after that testing start from Pollock
almost gets a leading edge as he tries to turn into the leg side, eventually rolls safely back down the pitch
turned off the stumps backward of square on the leg side and Morton is off the mark
tries to turn into the leg side again, nearly another leading edge on this slow pitch goes into the off side
edges down by his feet and the balls goes into the off side
short and pulled, but straight at square leg
driven but without much power, wide of mid-on for a single
top shot, overpitched and on the pads allowing Morton to go through midwicket with a big flourish
this time he drives powerfully past mid-off for another boundary, another impressive stroke from Morton but can he hold it together
driven straight at mid-off
back of a length and punched into the covers
on off stump, defended with a straight bat to mid-off
same line and length from Pollock, what he's been doing for the last 12 years, and defended into the covers
Chattergoon goes fishing this time, but doesn't quite succeed in offering Boucher a catch as he pushes outside off stump
played from the crease into the covers
wild swing from Chattergoon who goes for a pull against a ball that isn't short enough and is lucky not to lose his off stump
steals a single down to third man off the edge to keep the strike
good start, outside off stump going across the left hander who drives at fresh air
turned into the leg side
driven firmly to mid-off
another wild drive outside off stump and Chattergoon is trying his best to give an edge behind
finds the edge this time as he prods forward again, but it doesn't carry to Kallis at second slip and it also goes through his legs and down to third man
much more convincing shot this time, foot to the pitch outside off stump and driven through the covers...so a good over costs eight for Langeveldt
nips back into Morton, taken high on the pads
defended into the leg side
pushed square on the off side
draws Morton forward and takes the edge down to third man
forced square on the off side behind point, third man is around swiftly and keeps then to a single
dropped into the off side, he wants a single but it's not an option
driven into the covers, four men in the ring and the man on the edge - Botha - does the fielding, but he was so deep there could have been a single
defended down to mid-off
a hint of movement away from Chattergoon who plants his foot and drives, the ball shoots close to the edge and through to Boucher
punched into the covers
goes for a pull but the ball is onto him quicker than he expected and he nearly spoons a catch to mid-on
chopped into the covers and can't beat the ring
defended from off stump back to the bowler
turned into the leg side
a play and miss outside off stump as Morton continues to be troubled by this fine spell from Pollock
can't get this away as he defends back to Pollock
played from the crease, the bowler fields again
chopped down to Gibbs at gully
outside off stump and handsomely driven through the covers...Chattergoon has mixed the wild wafts with some well-timed drives
outside off and left alone
defended down to mid-on
pushed up to mid-off, West Indies need to take more singles and keep the scoreboard ticking
goes for the cut, doesn't time it out to point
a touch short and he's onto it quickly, pulling over midwicket for another boundary...any time the bowlers have dropped short in this match they have gone the distance
good start, angled in and Morton hurriedly digs it out
driven hard to mid-on, an upright and lazy-looking stroke
beaten for pace as he falls to the off, a thick inside edge spares the umpire from a decision
turned languidly round the corner, long leg has a fair way to run round to his left and that allows them to come back for the second
back and pushed into the covers from right back on his stumps
fired in at his legs, Morton misses with a swish which, ad it connected, would have taken the ball over midwicket
forward and pushed solidly into the covers
lovely shot, he leans back and slams that through point, it fizzes across the outfield
slower ball deceives him, he takes it on the pad and Morton yells to him to run ... he does and gets in the way of the underarm throw at the non-striker's end for good measure!
forward and jabbed into the off side
leans back and tries to force it off the back foot but only succeeds in smacking it into the pitch and it loops to point
back and defended
round the wicket, defended out to point
driven with power but straight at point, de Villiers felt that one as he took it
too much width and cut away down to third man, beats a sprinting Makhaya Ntini into the fence
driven back to Morkel off half the bat
full from Morkel and takes Chattergoon on the pad, an appeal from the bowler but it's going well down leg side...no one else was interested
another half shout as Chattergoon is square-up and plays to cover
driven to mid-off who is fairly deep and allows a comfortable single
round the wicket, bat and pad together and defended into the covers
short, wide and cut away but he can't find the gap...Langeveldt got away with that one

the breakthrough for South Africa! This one is closer to Chattergoon and bounces a little outside off stump, Chattergoon goes for the cut but is cramped for room and gets a top edge through to Boucher
onto the front foot and driven with purpose to mid-off
handsomely driven towards mid-off, but the fielder makes good ground to his left and prevents any runs
defended into the covers
tucked onto the leg side and the chance spotted for a quick run
defended down to point, Morkel is extracting some extra bounce with his height
superb short ball from Morkel, climbs and nips back at Samuels who plays it well by dropping the hands and swaying backwards like a limbo dancer...top cricket all-round
dropped into the leg side and Samuels sets off, he was to but in the hard yards as Steyn is swift from mid-on
takes Morton high on the back leg and bobbles into the slip area
another outside edge wide of the lone slip, Morkel does some effective work down at third man
well bowled by Langeveldt, beats Morton on the inside edge as he plays outside the line of the ball in defence
driven on the up to cover
played from the crease back down the pitch
forced down to mid-off, it's hit fairly hard at mid-off but they still opt for a single. Andre Nel, the sub fielder, can take the ball cleanly otherwise it may have been close
pushed into the covers
driven to mid-off who is on the edge of the ring but with such force that they don't take the single
plays across the line and Morkel goes up for a rather late appeal...not a million miles away but too much doubt
beaten for pace as he gets an inside edge close to the stumps and down to fine leg
wide outside off stump and tempts Samuels into a wild slash and he doesn't make contact
outside off stump and left alone on this occasion as Samuels learns from his error

beauty! Well bowled from Morkel, a rising delivery just outside off stump which Samuels is forced to play at but doesn't get behind the line. A regulation edge goes through to Boucher and South Africa well on top
worked off the stumps backward of square on the leg side
round the wicket, nudged around the corner by Chanderpaul in typical style to open his account
tossed up outside off stump uses his feet and defends to cover
tries to glide to third man, misses and it's taken by Boucher
very full and dug out down to long-on
whipped nicely wide of mid-on and it's a lengthy chase for Pollock, who does well to keep them down to two

gone! Another soft wicket by West Indies, an awful shot from Morton who tries to pull a ball that isn't short enough and spoons a simple catch to mid-off. That's reminiscent of a few of Morton's dismissals on this tour
goes for the yorker, good effort, comes out a full toss and Bravo jams it into the ground and down to mid-on
outside off and left alone
drifts down the leg side
rides the extra bounce nicely and flips the ball down to fine leg
round the wicket, outside off and left alone
defended up to mid-off
nice flight and Bravo is beaten is he comes forward, Boucher can't take cleanly
defended into the leg side, no chance of a single
comes across the crease and nudged into the leg side
rocks back and cuts a short ball through point, the cover sweeper keeps them to a single
turned to midwicket without finding a gap
hint of turn and Chanderpaul is slightly squared-up as he plays to cover
tucked into the gap at midwicket with a roll of the wrists...early thoughts of two, but that isn't on
defended up to mid-on
nudged down the pitch, it hits Bravo's bat at the non-striker's end as South Africa get a helping hand in the field
left alone outside off...West Indies haven't got time to be leaving deliveries
driven to cover and Morkel has overstepped so we have the excitement of a free hit
well play by Chanderpaul, he gives himself a touch of room as Morkel goes for the yorker at leg stump and it races through the covers. Nel does some good work on the rope
defended into the covers
nudged down to long-on
straighter ball takes the outside edge down to short third man
full delivery and chipped down the ground to long-on
worked to midwicket
arm ball from Botha, beats Chanderpaul in the flight and he nearly drags the ball back into his stumps
worked up to long-on, but singles aren't really helping West Indies now
hurries Chanderpaul into a defensive stroke, the ball bounces close to the stumps but safely back to Boucher
driven with sweet timing through the covers
steered off the back foot through backward point, it's very well timed and third man has to put in some big strides to reach it
takes the pad, not going down leg by that much but hardly an appeal, and an extra into the leg side
good bouncer, Chanderpaul decides to go underneath and has to go down very low, ending up virtually sat on the pitch
another short one banged in, Chanderpaul goes for the pull this time and gets a glove down to fine leg...quick over from Steyn
pushed square on the off side
low full toss punched back to the bowler
there's screaming everywhere with this delivery. Botha goes up for an lbw shout as Bravo sweeps, then Boucher has a shy at the stumps for a run out which would have been gone
turned into the leg side
again picks out midwicket and the innings is going nowhere
driven through point and placed well enough for Chanderpaul to come back for two even though he is hobbling
defended from the crease into the leg side
comes half forward but can only defend to cover...are West Indies just blocking out the last 20 overs?
whipped off the hips with a Caribbean flourish through midwicket but Kallis, back on the field, keeps them to one
angled out to point
slower ball worked off the pads down to fine leg
full outside off stump, driven through the covers but again it's only a single as more lightening-fast fielding is produced
worked up to long-on
angled away with the spin to short third man
misses an attempted cut and nearly gives Boucher another catch
low full toss whipped down the ground, Botha giving it plenty of air
tossed up, holds up a little off the pitch and worked into the leg side
quicker ball fired in at Bravo's feet, he digs it out to midwicket for, yes, another single
on the stumps and worked to midwicket
punched back to the bowler
gone! Defended down to point, Bravo sets off down the pitch but is sent back. Even with a dive he can't beat de Villiers's direct hit and the TV umpire confirms he is gone by a few inches
punched into the covers
on the stumps, Ramdin jabs down to defend

and another! The collapse continues as Ramdin tries to cut a ball that was too full and too close to him, dragging a bottom edge into his stumps. More reward for Pollock and West Indies' sad procession continues
played back down the pitch
hint of turn and Chanderpaul plays down onto the leg side
cramped for room as he tries to cut into the covers
placed through the covers
driven firmly to cover and it's another good piece of fielding
inside edge into his pads and Boucher collects
outside off and left alone
takes the pad and an appeal from Pollock, but he's the only one interested...too high
clips the pad as it goes down the leg side so Pollock avoids a wide call
defended down by his feet
defended into the covers, they aren't even trying to score now...it's all gone very sleepy
defended into the covers, a maiden in the 33rd over with an asking rate of over nine...amazing. Outstanding stuff from Pollock
ripped between bat and pad and just bounces over the stumps, he should have been well forward
defended into the covers
guess what, yep, defended back to Botha
turned to square leg, Chanderpaul's runner is having a quiet time
beaten by a hint of turn as he tries to drive
very full and dug out back down the track
steady on folks, a single through the covers as Sammy forces off the back foot
all defence from Chanderpaul. Maybe he thinks he can save the match?
nudged into the leg side and Steyn and midwicket gets into a tangle with the runner
pulled through midwicket
flashes outside off stump, thick outside edge down to third man
left alone, at the end of the 35th over, I'm speechless (or wordless)...almost
driven up to long-off
turned into midwicket
nudged into the leg side without any force
defended to the off side
arm ball, takes the outside edge into the covers
even a loopy low full toss can only be slapped up to mid-on for a single
wow, aggression from Chanderpaul as he swings Morkel over square leg, one bounce to the deep square-leg man
good short ball from Morkel, but poorly played from Sammy as he pushes his gloves straight towards it and takes his eyes off the ball
nice follow up, a tempter outside off stump which Sammy has a flash at without making contact
a wild mow back down the pitch, Morkel fields in his follow through
put out the bunting, set up the party stalls, it's a boundary...the first since the 17th over as Sammy heaves wide of mid-on
turned through square leg
worked through the off side
pushed down to long-on and Langeveldt is slow to the ball so allows two
tries to guide this one fine, misses and Boucher takes
quicker ball turned to midwicket
full and a hint of width, Sammy drives with a high elbow through the covers with the placement for two more
flicked down to long-on and again Langeveldt is slow and Sammy sprints back for too...Sammy looks too low in this order at No. 8
overpitched and Chanderpaul launches into a drive, through the covers and beats the sweeper into the boundary
now he plays a one-handed slash through backward point which beats third man...clearly Chanderpaul has had this under control throughout
chops down by his feet, quick single
carved over cover by Sammy, leans back and lets his arms swing through the line and it raced to the fence
fired down the leg side, the pressure of those boundaries seems to have got to him
gone! Morkel has his moment at the of an expensive over, Sammy pokes at a shorter ball outside off stump and sends another simple catch through to Boucher
played into the covers to end an eventful over
chopped away down to third man from outside off stump
onto the front foot and defended into the covers
driven through the covers out to the sweeper
pushed into the covers
guided behind point with soft hands, third man has to run around and do the fielding
backward point dives and makes the save this time as Chanderpaul cuts again
angled out to point as he hops across the crease
outside off stump and a flat-footed waft from Rampaul gets nowhere near it
big swing and miss time, he was nowhere near that with his feet, head or bat
punched to point and Rampaul can't find any gaps in a strong cover field
gone! banged in and brings the pull from Rampaul, the top edge goes high behind the batsman and Smith makes excellent ground from slip to take a good catch over his shoulder heading towards third man
goes for the pull and gets it down to fine leg to keep the strike
flicked effortlessly over midwicket, in the air a couple of bounces away for a boundary
comes forward and defends
swung away again over the leg side, poor ball on leg stump, and Chanderpaul continues his late defiance
driven firmly at cover
placed through the covers
a real tailender's blow from Edwards as he swings high and handsome over mid-off, one bounce for a four

dropped short ball, Chanderpaul goes for the pull and the ball loops back towards Steyn who sticks out a hand but can't hold on. I think he thought it was coming quicker than it was and then signals that he didn't pick it up
slower ball pushed to cover
short and pulled down to fine leg, manages to come back for a brace thanks to his runner
another slow ball which is hammered straight at cover
sharper bouncer, directed at Chanderpaul's head, and he ducks just in time
wayward ball fired down the leg side
driven through the covers
angled out to backward point
goes in the air over extra cover, a few bounces into the boundary and brings up Chanderpaul's fifty off 68 balls...amazingly swift considering out much blocking he did
pushed down to mid-off
bottom-edged onto the covers
tries to force this away, but finds de Villiers at point
driven through the covers
good yorker, well dug out into the off side
slower ball driven through the covers
gee, he almost ended up by the square-leg umpire as he backed away and tried to slap a back-of-a-length ball through the covers...it didn't work
clever slower ball, full on the stumps and Edwards spots it just in time to drive back to Steyn
a huge swing outside off stump, Edwards almost ends up on his back
rapid yorker, misses the target of leg stump as Edwards is more concerned about getting his toes out of the way
driven confidently through extra cover, but it exposes Edwards again
backs away and drives a full ball down to long-off, they pinch a second after some sloppy fielding...Langeveldt nearly took a blow in the mouth
more dancing towards leg stump from Edwards, he misses another wild mow
clubbed out to deep square
pushed to cover
helped to backward point...one more over ticked off, four remaining
Edwards backs away again, Steyn follows him and pretends to play a cricket shot but not one I've ever seen before
sliced away into the deep, drops short of Morkel at deep cover
slower ball clubbed to mid-off
banged in and paddled through square leg
someone Edwards keeps getting bat on the straight one as he hacks to mid-on
sliced away on the off side, de Villiers intercepts and a direct hit would have had Edwards short
defended on off stump
pokes outside off stump and is beaten
gone! Chanderpaul's plainly odd - and poor - innings comes to end with a tame flick to midwicket. He never seemed to know what he was doing, and neither did anyone else
defended back to the bowler
misses leg stump by a coat of varnish as Taylor tries to flick through the leg side

oh dear, in every sense of the word...Taylor slams the ball to mid off and sprints down for single, Edwards doesn't move but Kallis's throw is not being backed up and Edwards has time to canter through to the other end
chopped down very near off stump

gone, and that's the match for South Africa although we knew the outcome of this game a long while along. Taylor swings the ball high to mid-on where Steyn back-peddles for the catch...a career-best for Morne Morkel, a fine effort as he continues his recovery from injury
